item.title: V2 Roadmap - Contributions welcome!
item.description:
üëã hello folks!

As we look towards upstreaming our work on `actionview-component` into Rails, it feels like it might be time to think about working towards a major release.

item.title: Remove fallback support for old render syntax
item.description:
We have two cases where we support old syntax in `actionview-component`:

https://github.com/github/actionview-component/blob/1164a2e7eba2de8e0808be27a77c0495fad23d26/lib/action_view/component/monkey_patch.rb#L10

https://github.com/github/actionview-component/blob/master/lib/action_view/component/test_helpers.rb#L20

Let's remove these cases and the associated tests, merging right before we cut `v2.0.0`."

item.title: Include test case class for components
item.description:
Here is what I'm currently using on my `test_helper.rb` file.

```ruby
class ActionView::ComponentTest < ActiveSupport::TestCase
include ActionView::Component::TestHelpers
end
```

I think it's a good idea to provide this base for class for testing components."

item.title: Compile components on application boot
item.description: In production, it would probably make sense to `compile` all descendents of `ActionView::Component::Base`, so that components render quickly on the first request, instead of compiling lazily as they do now."

item.title: Any tips for rendering Components from collections?
item.description:
Before I start playing around with this, I wanted to ask if there is a preferred way, best practice, or even a helper to render components for collections similar to the rails guide for partials

I think this would be a common use case, and would be willing to submit a PR for a documentation example."

item.title: Wanted: Experience Reports
item.description:
üëã thanks for checking out `actionview-component`!

In sharing this gem with the Rails community, we are looking to hear about your experiences with using `ActionView::Component` in your applications.

Please let us know what works well, what doesn't, and what you think is missing ‚ù§Ô∏è

If you'd rather provide feedback privately, feel free to contact me at joelhawksley@github.com."
